title: Mennas
data:
***Version [0.31](/0.31 "0.31")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

*For a list of all holy monsters, see [list of holy monsters](/List_of_holy_monsters "List of holy monsters").*

| Mennas A [![Mennas.png](/images/b/b6/Mennas.png)](/File:Mennas.png) |                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| ------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |

| [Will](/Willpower "Willpower")                                      | 160                                                                                                                                                                                               |

| Attack2                                                             | 20 ([hit](/Attack_type "Attack type"): [plain](/Attack_flavour "Attack flavour"))                                                                                                                 |
| [Resistances](/Resistance "Resistance")                             | [rElec](/Electricity "Electricity") [rPois+](/Poison "Poison") [rMiasma](/Miasma "Miasma") [rN+++](/Negative_energy "Negative energy") [rHoly](/Resistance "Resistance")                          |

|   |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
| - | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | There was once a human priest named Mennas. He travelled far and wide preaching of Zin to any who would listen, going even so far as to travel into Orcish lands, preaching to orcs about laws and mercy. By all accounts the orcs were not happy with Mennas. They demanded he swear Beogh was the one true god, and when Mennas remained silent they cut out his tongue.Whether or not this angel is that same Mennas is something of a mystery, as he seems to have difficulty speaking. |

## Contents

- [1 Useful Info](#Useful_Info)
- [2 Location](#Location)
- [3 Spells](#Spells)
- [4 Tips & Tricks](#Tips_.26_Tricks)
- [5 Trivia](#Trivia)
- [6 History](#History)

## Useful Info

**Mennas, the Voice of Zin** is an incredibly dangerous [unique](/Unique "Unique") [angel](/Angel "Angel"), the only one who normally appears in the main [Dungeon](/Dungeon "Dungeon") not locked behind a wall. He is fast, extremely durable, and disables many player abilities with [Silence](/Silence "Silence"), making him a notorious menace to spellcasters.

## Location

- [The Depths](/The_Depths "The Depths"):3-5
- [The Vaults](/The_Vaults "The Vaults"):2-5
- [The Crypt](/The_Crypt "The Crypt")
- [The Tomb](/The_Tomb "The Tomb")
- [Pandemonium](/Pandemonium "Pandemonium")

## Spells

| Spell set I |                                                         |                                                     |
| :---------- | ------------------------------------------------------- | --------------------------------------------------- |
| Slot1       | [Mass Confusion](/Mass_Confusion "Mass Confusion")      | [Wizard flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |
| Slot2       | [Silence](/Silence "Silence")                           | [Wizard flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |
| Slot3       | [Minor Healing](/Minor_Healing "Minor Healing") (2d9+3) | [Wizard flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |

## Tips & Tricks

- Mennas is a nasty foe. It's *very* difficult to escape from him: he has the speed of a [hasted](/Haste "Haste") Human, and his [Silence](/Silence "Silence") disables [scrolls](/Scroll "Scroll"), [god](/God "God") abilities, and [spells](/Spell "Spell") entirely. He's also quite durable and annoyingly evasive. If you were already low HP, and Mennas shows up, it's a big problem. Don't underestimate him, even if you're in [extended](/Extended "Extended").

  - As a holy monster, he is even more deadly to [undead](/Undead "Undead"), [Demonspawn](/Demonspawn "Demonspawn"), and [Death Form](/Death_Form "Death Form") players.
  - If you see Mennas and don't think you can handle him, act immediately. You can initiate a [scroll of teleport](/Scroll_of_teleport "Scroll of teleport"), and even if you're silenced afterwards, it will still activate. Using [Haste](/Haste "Haste") before he's in melee range allows you to run to a nearby stairs.
  - [Wands](/Wand "Wand") and other [evocables](/Evocable "Evocable") still work during silence. A [wand of quicksilver](/Wand_of_quicksilver "Wand of quicksilver"), if it hits, will end the Silence spell. A [phial of floods](/Phial_of_floods "Phial of floods") prevents him from casting Silence for a short while. Using a [phantom mirror](/Phantom_mirror "Phantom mirror") can be risky, since the Mennas clone can end up casting Silence (although you can attack the clone to dispel it instantly).
  - [Invisibility](/Invisibility "Invisibility"), by potion or [ability](/Ability "Ability"), can be extremely useful, as long as you stay outside of Mennas' [halo](/Halo "Halo").
  - His [willpower](/Willpower "Willpower") is usually too high for a [wand of paralysis](/Wand_of_paralysis "Wand of paralysis") or the like to work. A [scroll of vulnerability](/Scroll_of_vulnerability "Scroll of vulnerability") with a high Evocations wand can disable him, though note that the scroll will make you susceptible to his Mass Confusion.
  - [Shafts](/Shaft "Shaft"), if you happen to find one (or be a [Formicid](/Formicid "Formicid")) can let you escape an adjacent Mennas.

- If you do try to fight Mennas, plan accordingly. A mid-level "tank" character should be able to overcome Mennas with [haste](/Haste "Haste") and [might](/Might "Might"). [Berserk](/Berserk "Berserk") gives both effects, but if it runs out, the silence puts you in even more danger than usual. Casters have a much harder time, for rather obvious reasons.

  - Mennas' guaranteed [tower shield](/Tower_shield "Tower shield") makes him significantly more durable in combat. If possible, use attacks that bypass shields, such as piercing, area-of-effect, or [smite-targeted](/Smite-targeted "Smite-targeted") attacks.
  - Casters can use spells that have lasting effects, such as Summoning spells ([Malign Gateway](/Malign_Gateway "Malign Gateway"), [Dragon's Call](/Dragon%27s_Call "Dragon's Call")) or [Polar Vortex](/Polar_Vortex "Polar Vortex").
  - If you have [Passage of Golubria](/Passage_of_Golubria "Passage of Golubria"), cast it before engaging to set up an emergency exit. If you do, remember that the portals will last 10-19 turns, so reassess the fight after a few turns and escape if it's not going well.

- Remember that he can use [Mass Confusion](/Mass_Confusion "Mass Confusion") if not currently under silence. Good [willpower](/Willpower "Willpower") is important to avoid being confused, then silenced, then [YASDed](/YASD "YASD").

- If you notice him without waking him up, remember that you can just walk away. Returning later with more experience and better equipment can make a huge difference (alternatively, just avoid him entirely -- you are under no obligation to kill every enemy you see).

## Trivia

[Mennas](http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Menas_of_Constantinople\&redirect=no) was a Catholic saint of the early Christian church. He lived in the 6th century, and was excommunicated twice (and pardoned both times).

## History

- Prior to [0.28](/0.28 "0.28"), Mennas could [see invisible](/See_invisible "See invisible").
- Prior to [0.16](/0.16 "0.16"), Mennas could not spawn in [Pandemonium](/Pandemonium "Pandemonium") and knew [Confusion](/Confusion "Confusion") instead of [Mass Confusion](/Mass_Confusion "Mass Confusion").
- Prior to [0.15](/0.15 "0.15"), worshipers of [good gods](/Good_gods "Good gods") would have a [piety](/Piety "Piety")-based chance of turning Mennas neutral when they encountered him.
- Mennas was added in version [0.8](/0.8 "0.8").
html:
Mennas

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.31: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.

For a list of all holy monsters, see list of holy monsters.

Mennas A 
HP 100-203
HD 19
XP 7881
Speed 15
AC 15
EV 26
Will 160
Attack1 30 (hit: plain)
Attack2 20 (hit: plain)


Resistances rElec
rPois+
rMiasma
rN+++
rHoly
Vulnerabilities None
Habitat Land
Intelligence Human
Uses Weapons & armour
Starting equipment
Open doors
Holiness Holy
Size Medium
Type angel, angel
Flags Fighter
Flying
Speaks
Unique
Male
There was once a human priest named Mennas. He travelled far and wide preaching of Zin to any who would listen, going even so far as to travel into Orcish lands, preaching to orcs about laws and mercy. By all accounts the orcs were not happy with Mennas. They demanded he swear Beogh was the one true god, and when Mennas remained silent they cut out his tongue.

Whether or not this angel is that same Mennas is something of a mystery, as he seems to have difficulty speaking.

Contents

  • 1 Useful Info
  • 2 Location
  • 3 Spells
  • 4 Tips & Tricks
  • 5 Trivia
  • 6 History

Useful Info

Mennas, the Voice of Zin is an incredibly dangerous unique angel, the only one who normally appears in the main Dungeon not locked behind a wall. He is fast, extremely durable, and disables many player abilities with Silence, making him a notorious menace to spellcasters.

Location

  • The Depths:3-5
  • The Vaults:2-5
  • The Crypt
  • The Tomb
  • Pandemonium

Spells

Spell set I
Slot1 Mass Confusion Wizard flag
Slot2 Silence Wizard flag
Slot3 Minor Healing (2d9+3) Wizard flag

Tips & Tricks

  • Mennas is a nasty foe. It's very difficult to escape from him: he has the speed of a hasted Human, and his Silence disables scrolls, god abilities, and spells entirely. He's also quite durable and annoyingly evasive. If you were already low HP, and Mennas shows up, it's a big problem. Don't underestimate him, even if you're in extended.
    • As a holy monster, he is even more deadly to undead, Demonspawn, and Death Form players.
    • If you see Mennas and don't think you can handle him, act immediately. You can initiate a scroll of teleport, and even if you're silenced afterwards, it will still activate. Using Haste before he's in melee range allows you to run to a nearby stairs.
    • Wands and other evocables still work during silence. A wand of quicksilver, if it hits, will end the Silence spell. A phial of floods prevents him from casting Silence for a short while. Using a phantom mirror can be risky, since the Mennas clone can end up casting Silence (although you can attack the clone to dispel it instantly).
    • Invisibility, by potion or ability, can be extremely useful, as long as you stay outside of Mennas' halo.
    • His willpower is usually too high for a wand of paralysis or the like to work. A scroll of vulnerability with a high Evocations wand can disable him, though note that the scroll will make you susceptible to his Mass Confusion.
    • Shafts, if you happen to find one (or be a Formicid) can let you escape an adjacent Mennas.
  • If you do try to fight Mennas, plan accordingly. A mid-level "tank" character should be able to overcome Mennas with haste and might. Berserk gives both effects, but if it runs out, the silence puts you in even more danger than usual. Casters have a much harder time, for rather obvious reasons.
    • Mennas' guaranteed tower shield makes him significantly more durable in combat. If possible, use attacks that bypass shields, such as piercing, area-of-effect, or smite-targeted attacks.
    • Casters can use spells that have lasting effects, such as Summoning spells (Malign Gateway, Dragon's Call) or Polar Vortex.
    • If you have Passage of Golubria, cast it before engaging to set up an emergency exit. If you do, remember that the portals will last 10-19 turns, so reassess the fight after a few turns and escape if it's not going well.
  • Remember that he can use Mass Confusion if not currently under silence. Good willpower is important to avoid being confused, then silenced, then YASDed.
  • If you notice him without waking him up, remember that you can just walk away. Returning later with more experience and better equipment can make a huge difference (alternatively, just avoid him entirely -- you are under no obligation to kill every enemy you see).

Trivia

Mennas was a Catholic saint of the early Christian church. He lived in the 6th century, and was excommunicated twice (and pardoned both times).

History

  • Prior to 0.28, Mennas could see invisible.
  • Prior to 0.16, Mennas could not spawn in Pandemonium and knew Confusion instead of Mass Confusion.
  • Prior to 0.15, worshipers of good gods would have a piety-based chance of turning Mennas neutral when they encountered him.
  • Mennas was added in version 0.8.
Retrieved from "http://crawl.chaosforge.org/index.php?title=Mennas&oldid=80197"

rawPage:
{{version031}}
{{list of | holy monsters}}
{{monster info}}

==Useful Info==
'''Mennas, the Voice of Zin''' is an incredibly dangerous [[unique]] [[angel]], the only one who normally appears in the main [[Dungeon]] not locked behind a wall. He is fast, extremely durable, and disables many player abilities with [[Silence]], making him a notorious menace to spellcasters.

==Location==
*[[The Depths]]:3-5
*[[The Vaults]]:2-5
*[[The Crypt]]
*[[The Tomb]]
*[[Pandemonium]]

{{monster spells}}

==Tips & Tricks==
*Mennas is a nasty foe. It's ''very'' difficult to escape from him: he has the speed of a [[haste]]d Human, and his [[Silence]] disables [[scroll]]s, [[god]] abilities, and [[spell]]s entirely. He's also quite durable and annoyingly evasive. If you were already low HP, and Mennas shows up, it's a big problem. Don't underestimate him, even if you're in [[extended]].
**As a holy monster, he is even more deadly to [[undead]], [[Demonspawn]], and [[Death Form]] players.
**If you see Mennas and don't think you can handle him, act immediately. You can initiate a [[scroll of teleport]], and even if you're silenced afterwards, it will still activate. Using [[Haste]] before he's in melee range allows you to run to a nearby stairs.
**[[Wand]]s and other [[evocable]]s still work during silence. A [[wand of quicksilver]], if it hits, will end the Silence spell. A [[phial of floods]] prevents him from casting Silence for a short while. Using a [[phantom mirror]] can be risky, since the Mennas clone can end up casting Silence (although you can attack the clone to dispel it instantly).
**[[Invisibility]], by potion or [[ability]], can be extremely useful, as long as you stay outside of Mennas' [[halo]].
**His [[willpower]] is usually too high for a [[wand of paralysis]] or the like to work. A [[scroll of vulnerability]] with a high Evocations wand can disable him, though note that the scroll will make you susceptible to his Mass Confusion.
**[[Shaft]]s, if you happen to find one (or be a [[Formicid]]) can let you escape an adjacent Mennas.
*If you do try to fight Mennas, plan accordingly. A mid-level "tank" character should be able to overcome Mennas with [[haste]] and [[might]]. [[Berserk]] gives both effects, but if it runs out, the silence puts you in even more danger than usual. Casters have a much harder time, for rather obvious reasons.
**Mennas' guaranteed [[tower shield]] makes him significantly more durable in combat. If possible, use attacks that bypass shields, such as piercing, area-of-effect, or [[smite-targeted]] attacks.
**Casters can use spells that have lasting effects, such as Summoning spells ([[Malign Gateway]], [[Dragon's Call]]) or [[Polar Vortex]].
**If you have [[Passage of Golubria]], cast it before engaging to set up an emergency exit. If you do, remember that the portals will last 10-19 turns, so reassess the fight after a few turns and escape if it's not going well.
*Remember that he can use [[Mass Confusion]] if not currently under silence. Good [[willpower]] is important to avoid being confused, then silenced, then [[YASD]]ed.
*If you notice him without waking him up, remember that you can just walk away. Returning later with more experience and better equipment can make a huge difference (alternatively, just avoid him entirely -- you are under no obligation to kill every enemy you see).

==Trivia==
[http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Menas_of_Constantinople&redirect=no Mennas] was a Catholic saint of the early Christian church. He lived in the 6th century, and was excommunicated twice (and pardoned both times).

==History==
*Prior to [[0.28]], Mennas could [[see invisible]].
*Prior to [[0.16]], Mennas could not spawn in [[Pandemonium]] and knew [[Confusion]] instead of [[Mass Confusion]].
*Prior to [[0.15]], worshipers of [[good gods]] would have a [[piety]]-based chance of turning Mennas neutral when they encountered him.
*Mennas was added in version [[0.8]].
